definition.title: What is Adenoidectomy?
definition.content: Adenoidectomy is a surgical procedure to remove the adenoids, which are small gland-like structures located at the back of the nasal cavity. They help fight off infections. Adenoidectomy is commonly performed in children who experience chronic ear or sinus infections, breathing problems, or obstructive sleep apnea. Latest techniques, such as minimally invasive adenoidectomy, offer improved recovery and reduced risks compared to traditional methods.

treatment.title: Treatment Options
treatment.content: Treatment for adenoid-related issues may involve medication, such as antibiotics or steroids. In cases where medication is not effective or adenoid enlargement causes severe problems, adenoidectomy may be required. Several techniques are available, including traditional and latest adenoidectomy.
